critique: This document is an executive order from 1946 authorizing the Secretary of Agriculture to take possession of and operate plants and facilities involved in the production, processing, transportation, sale, or distribution of livestock, meat, meat products, and by-products due to labor disturbances that were impeding the war effort. It grants broad powers to the Secretary of Agriculture, including the ability to hire employees, manage properties, and request protection from the Secretary of War. The order emphasizes the need to maintain production during the war and provides for the return of the facilities to their owners once the disturbances have ceased.
